text: Generally I think there are somehow too- many participants involved in supply chain to get the same level of "Consensus".
<@U0NCW1DPX>: are you using the hyperledger framework for your use case, have you considered other options out there . Also, how do you intend to show cost savings ?

<@U1A9JNB1T>: we are trying the hl framework, and will try ethereum in private as well (we should not consider any public chain solution for industry customer). For the cost savings, many things we want to highlight for example: realtime tracking, easy to find the problem components in defective product and easy to callback, reduce the cost of credit investigation for financial institution and easy to set the credit rating for participants in supply chain. Of cause, the bc is not silver bullet, it can not resolve everything, there are many apps and components off-chain we need develop. In our design, the bc is only used to record the transaction info and something can not be tampered, service for easy audit and tracking.
